qas.question: Who operates the ferry to Spain?
Where does the ferry to France terminate?
Along with MV Bretagne and MV Pont-Aven, what ferry operates between Plymouth and the continent?
A passenger ferry operates between Cremyll and what location?
When did the Cremyll-Stonehouse ferry first operate?

context: A regular international ferry service provided by <a0_0>Brittany Ferries<a0_0/> operates from Millbay taking cars and foot passengers directly to France (<a1_0>Roscoff<a1_0/>) and Spain (Santander) on the three ferries, <a2_0>MV Armorique<a2_0/>, MV Bretagne and MV Pont-Aven. There is a passenger ferry between <a3_0>Stonehouse<a3_0/> and the Cornish hamlet of Cremyll, which is believed to have operated continuously since <a4_0>1204<a4_0/>. There is also a pedestrian ferry from the Mayflower Steps to Mount Batten, and an alternative to using the Tamar Bridge via the Torpoint Ferry (vehicle and pedestrian) across the River Tamar.
